title._content: Children Watch Hybrid Bears at National Zoological Park

description._content: Photographer: Unknown Date: 1950s Type: Photographic print Standard number: 2003-19491 Summary: Children watch hybrid bears through iron bars at the National Zoo during the 1950's. Older enclosures such as these were commonly used to display zoo animals. Although these types of enclosures are not the most visually appealing, they were practical for keeping a clean environment essential for the health of the animals. Today, as zoos modernize, enclosures that exhibit several species in a more naturalistic setting are more popular Persistent URL: siarchives.si.edu/collections/siris_sic_10131 Repository:Smithsonian Archives - History Div View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
